original_title: National Business Excellence Awards 2025 to honour top performers on 24 July
original_body_lines: The National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka will hold the National Business Excellence Awards (NBEA) on Thursday, 24 July, at the Shangri-La Colombo, commencing at 6 p.m.
Celebrating its 20th consecutive year, the NBEA stands as one of Sri Lanka’s most prestigious platforms recognising and rewarding outstanding business achievements.
Over the past two decades, the Awards have honoured companies that demonstrate excellence in business and organisational performance across a wide range of sectors.

This year’s milestone event is expected to bring together leading business leaders, entrepreneurs, government officials, and diplomatic representatives to honour the highest standards of corporate excellence and sustainability. The awards evaluation process is led by a highly respected Panel of Judges, ensuring transparency, integrity, and rigorous assessment.

NCCSL said 145 nominees across 26 sectors and business categories will be unveiled during the ceremony, which will be followed by a gala sit-down dinner and networking opportunities for distinguished guests. The grand ceremony will be graced by the Chief Guest, High Commission of New Zealand to Sri Lanka David Gregory Pine, Guest of Honour, South African High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Sandile Edwin Schalk.

The National Business Excellence Awards 2025 continues its mission to inspire, benchmark, and celebrate excellence in the Sri Lankan corporate world. The evaluations for this prestigious awards ceremony were conducted through a comprehensive process, beginning with a Technical and Financial Evaluation Committee headed by Ernst & Young Partner – Assurance Sanath Fernando, and followed by an eminent Panel of Judges co-chaired by Postgraduate Institute of Management (PIM), Senior Professor in Management and Board of Management Former Director and Chairman Prof. Ajantha Dharmasiri and Lasantha Salgado, an experienced HR professional, a consultant in HRM and Labour Law, practicing Attorney-at-Law (Labour Law and Industrial Relations).
